instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2532: What is 820-2532? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6258: What is ISL6258? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL is another way to say SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL, look at the definition provided for SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL as it applies to .

threads.title: LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board with Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message:
Looking at a 2009 macbook pro LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
No light on charger

no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin resistance on:
17/18 => 20.7
27/28=> 20.5

voltage on...
pin 1 = 16.78v
pin 2 = 16.78v
pin 3 = 4.02v
pin 19 = 5v
pin 20 = 5v

pin 21,23,24 =0.7v
ping 25 = 4.5V

Need to replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> as does not appear to be working.

Will a <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>  on old 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  be compatible?

threads.title: LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board with Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Both <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>/32 use the same <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP> chip.

threads.title: LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board with Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message:
Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and now getting steady green light. 12.3V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> which seems a little low.  Board not connected to battery.
diode mode(red probe on GND)
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL</SIGNAL> = 5.2
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA</SIGNAL> = 5.3

Voltage...
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL</SIGNAL> =3.4v
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA</SIGNAL> = 3.4v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>=3.3v.

bad SMC?

threads.title: LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board with Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message:
Note that diode mode MUST always be tested with red probe connected to ground.
And do NOT write the "V" at the end of diode mode reading; avoid any confusion with a voltage measurement.

Power must be disconnected before check in diode mode, or ohm scale.
Even better allow 10s, to discharge remanent voltages.

threads.title: LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board with Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message:
My bad on the diode "v" (edited the above) . Just to clarify, for the above diode reading, board was not connected to power.
Could anything else be pulling down the voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> or is this most likely a bad SMC?

Thanks for the guidance. Much appreciated!

threads.title: LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board with Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message: Can we get correct diode mode readings on SCL/SDA lines?

threads.title: LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board with Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board with Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message:
Too big difference there.
Did you check when <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> was removed?

Remove <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> and check again.
First, disconnect BIL and check.

threads.title: LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board with Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message:
I did not check when <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> was removed.
BIL not connected.

With <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> removed...

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL</SIGNAL> = 0.517
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA</SIGNAL> = 0.532

threads.title: LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board with Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message:
Still no good values.
Remove <CAPACITOR>C6952</CAPACITOR>/53 and test.
If still big difference, then remove <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and check again.
If no good, SMC is the last option.

threads.title: LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board with Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message:
I removed <CAPACITOR>C6952</CAPACITOR>/53 and measurements dropped slightly. 
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL</SIGNAL> = 0.510
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA</SIGNAL> = 0.522

Removed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> now getting:
 
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL</SIGNAL> = 0.597
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA</SIGNAL> = 0.698

threads.title: LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board with Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message:
You stil have big difference.
You may have bad solder, or broken trace for SDA line (to SMC).

BTW, when you remove something, values must increase.
Not for caps removing, but let time the board cools down.

threads.title: LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board with Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message:
I noticed the values changing between hot and cool board. I removed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> last night and checked it this morning.
I'll continue playing with this, but being an old board, I'll work on it when I have time.

My biggest issue is not being able to compare this to a working board.

Appreciate your help and guidance. Thank you!

threads.title: LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board with Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
LB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board with Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message: Yes, old board with GPU issue. I've been pulling components from it for last few months for other repairs.
